plugins.name: Icon Scaler
plugins.description:
ICON SCALER :

This plugin lets you scale one or multiple selected icons into multiple standard sizes in a single click — while preserving all their styles, groups, layers, strokes, and fills. No flattening. No distortion.


But that’s not all — It also automatically generates a variable component for each icon, so you can easily manage different icon sizes using Figma's powerful component properties.


Whether you’re preparing icon sets for design systems, exports, or different platform needs, this plugin automates the repetitive work — and gives you perfect consistency every time.


KEY FEATURES:

✅ Scale multiple icons at once into multiple sizes

✅ Preserves structure — no flattening or vector merging

✅ Creates a variable component with size modes for each icon

✅ UI with smart “chip-style” size selection + custom size support

✅ Neatly arranged output inside a new frame, ready to use or export
plugins.tagline: Create Icon Size Range and components instantly

134540.tagline: Create Icon Size Range and components instantly

plugins.name: Fast Page Selector
plugins.description:
Efficient page selection and navigation when working with files containing many pages.


Features

  1. Page Grouping: Automatically group pages using Divider pages (pages starting with `---` or containing `divider`)
  2. Select by select box: Display each group in select boxes for intuitive page selection
  3. Compact View: Hide/Show functionality to minimize plugin window and efficiently utilize workspace
plugins.tagline: Navigate hundreds of pages in a flash.

134511.release_notes: Fix cannot moving page when selected
134511.tagline: Navigate hundreds of pages in a flash.

plugins.name: QuickData
plugins.description:
QuickData helps you quickly populate and rename Figma text layers using live data from a public Google Sheet.

Just paste the link, choose your mode (fill, rename, or both), and watch your layers update instantly — no coding, no copy-paste hassle.

It’s perfect for localization, UI/UX content mapping, mock data generation, and large-scale text updates.
plugins.tagline: Auto-fill & rename text layers from Google Sheets

133953.name: QuickData
133953.description:
QuickData helps you quickly populate and rename Figma text layers using live data from a public Google Sheet.

Just paste the link, choose your mode (fill, rename, or both), and watch your layers update instantly — no coding, no copy-paste hassle.

It’s perfect for localization, UI/UX content mapping, mock data generation, and large-scale text updates.
133953.tagline: Auto-fill & rename text layers from Google Sheets

plugins.name: another-data-populator
plugins.description:
Another Data Populator


A Figma plugin that populates your designs with JSON.


How it works


1. Create a Layer Group that contains at least one Text Layer. In the Text Layer content, use placeholders for you data fields in double curly brackets – such as {{firstname}} or {{lastname}}. The plugin will replace all these placeholders with respective data. _Please note that if your Text Layer is called {{name}} (in the Layer List), the content of the Layer will always be overwritten with the data contained in {{name}}. So if you use multiple {{placeholders}} in a Text Layer, you should rename your Layer to something without curly brackets._


2. In the same Layer Group, create a Shape Layer (this is your image placeholder). Give the Shape Layer a placeholder name in double curly brackets – such as {{image}}. The plugin will replace this placeholder with respective image data (PNG or JPG).


3. For JSON arrays, create a Layer Group with a placeholder name like {{items}}. That group must contain one child Group Layer with the name {{template}}. This is the group that will be cloned and populated with the JSON array data. This works recursively with nested data. The array placeholder can have an optional limit filter {{items | limit 5}}, which will limit the number of {{template}} clones.


Available Commands


Populate with Dummy JSON

The plugin includes presets from https://dummyjson.com/ including:


- Products

- Carts

- Recipes

- Users

- Posts

- Comments

- Todos

- Quotes


Populate with Imported JSON

You can also upload any JSON file from your machine.


Filters

By appending your {{placeholder}} with one of the following available filters, separated by a |, you can use certain operations on your populated strings.


1. Maximum characters

You can set the maximum number of characters of your {{placeholder}} by appending it with | max n, 'n' representing the desired number of characters.


{{name | max 3}}


2. Date

Display {{placeholder}} in MM/DD/YYYY format.


{{dateTimeString | date}}


Conditional Actions

A Conditional Action performs a certain action on a Layer Group or Component based on data and a conditional expression. The Conditional Action is controlled by the name of the Layer Group (or Component).


1. #show[condition]

shows layer if true and hides otherwise


2. #hide[condition]

hides layer if true and shows otherwise


2. #duplicate[condition]

duplicate layer n times


3. #variant[condition, component property]

set component property based on condition


Examples

#show[{{firstname}}.length > 3]

shows layer if {{firstname}} has more than 3 characters and hides otherwise


#show[{{firstname}} == "Peter"]

shows layer if {{firstname}} is 'Peter' and hides otherwise


#duplicate[{{rating}}]

duplicates the layer by the value of {{rating}}


#variant[{{completed}}, Value Type = Checked]

sets the component property "Value Type" to "Checked" if {{completed}} is true


You can combine several conditions:


#show[{{firstname}}.includes('e') || {{firstname}}.length > 3]

shows layer if {{firstname}} includes 'e' or has more than 3 characters, hides otherwise


Or several Conditional Actions:


#variant[{{completed}}, Value Type = Checked] #variant[{{completed}}, State = Completed]

sets the component properties "Value Type" to "Checked" and "State" to "Completed" if {{completed}} is true


Pure JavaScript syntax is being used for Conditional Actions, so you can basically use anything available in JavaScript.
plugins.tagline: Populate your designs with JSON

plugins.name: adamantium token lab - analyze, organize & export tokens
plugins.description:
adamantium token lab

Your ultimate Figma Variables exporter & manager to rule your tokens.


Stop manually transcribing design tokens! adamantium token lab bridges the gap between your Figma Variables and your codebase, streamlining your design-to-development workflow with unparalleled power and flexibility.


Whether you're working with a simple project or a complex multi-library design system, adamantium token lab gives you the tools to view, manage, analyze, and export your design tokens exactly how you need them. Say goodbye to errors, inconsistencies, and wasted time.


Why You Need adamantium token lab:

  1. Bridge the Design-Dev Gap: Seamlessly translate your Figma Variables into production-ready code.
  2. Ensure Consistency: Maintain a single source of truth for your design tokens across all projects.
  3. Boost Efficiency: Automate token exports, saving hours and reducing manual errors.
  4. Unmatched Customization: Tailor token output to perfectly match your team's coding standards.
  5. Maintain a Clean Design System: Understand token usage, identify unused variables, and keep your system tidy.
  6. Empower Collaboration: Provide developers with exactly what they need, in their preferred format.
  7. Handle Complexity with Ease: Advanced features like comprehensive library alias resolution simplify managing large-scale design systems.



Core Features:

Token Viewing & Management:

  1. View all Figma Variables (colors, numbers, strings, booleans) in a dynamic, resizable table.
  2. See token names, descriptions, types, and values per mode at a glance.
  3. Toggle in-table alias resolution to see actual values directly.
  4. Customize the display format for color values (HEX, RGBA, HSLA, etc.) in the table.
  5. Easily filter and view tokens from specific collections.


Powerful & Highly Customizable Export Engine:

  1. Export to CSS Custom Properties.
  2. Export to SASS Variables ($var).
  3. Export to SASS Maps (Nested or Flat options available).
  4. Export to JSON (Structured or Nested, with options for flat key paths).
  5. Export a developer-friendly Intermediate Representation (IR) for custom workflows.
  6. Apply naming conventions: camelCase, PascalCase, kebab-case, snake_case, and more.
  7. Add custom prefixes and suffixes to token names or filenames.
  8. Define custom path separators for token names (e.g., -, _, .).
  9. Output colors in various formats: HEX, HEX8, RGB(A), HSL(A), HSB(A).
  10. Configure numeric units (px, rem, em, pt) and base font size for rem/em.
  11. Choose your alias strategy: embed resolved values or reference original variables/map keys.
  12. Optionally include collection and mode names in exported variable names.
  13. Include token descriptions as comments in your exported code.
  14. Output JSON color values as strings or structured objects.
  15. Customize CSS mode selector templates (e.g., :root[data-theme="$MODE"]).
  16. See an instant live preview of your export with syntax highlighting.
  17. Download generated token files easily.


Advanced Token Usage Analysis:

  1. Identify which design tokens are actively used in your Figma designs.
  2. Analyze token usage on the "Current Page" or across the "Entire File".
  3. View a "Used" column in the token table for clear visual indicators.
  4. See updated collection counts showing (used / total) tokens after analysis.
  5. View a prominent banner confirming the scope and results of the last analysis.
  6. Filter the token list to show "All," "Used," or "Unused" tokens.


Deep Library Integration (All Features Currently Enabled):

  1. Effortlessly work with variables from your enabled Figma libraries.
  2. See clear indicators for the source library of your collections, including the library name where available.
  3. Includes powerful, deep alias resolution across external libraries – essential for complex design systems, ensuring your exported values are always accurate.
  4. The UI intuitively displays information about library-linked aliases with distinct styling, providing full clarity in your token management.


Get Started with adamantium token lab Today!

Take control of your design tokens, accelerate your development process, and ensure unparalleled consistency across your projects. Install adamantium token lab and transform your Figma Variables workflow!



🌱 This is a Beta Version!

adamantium token lab is currently in active development and is being released as a Beta version. This means that while we've worked hard to make it powerful and stable, you might encounter occasional bugs or quirks.


Your Feedback is Gold! 🪙

We are incredibly passionate about making adamantium token lab the best token management tool for you, and your experience and insights are crucial to this journey. As you use the plugin, please help us improve by:


  1. Reporting any bugs or issues you encounter.
  2. Sharing your feature requests and ideas for new functionality.
  3. Letting us know what you love and what could be even better.


Your feedback will directly shape the future of adamantium token lab, helping us to squash bugs, refine features, and build the ultimate token workflow tool. We're committed to regular updates and improvements based on your input.
plugins.tagline: analyze, organize, name, export, cleanup. One token lab to rule your tokens (figma variables).

plugins.name: GPT to Canvas
plugins.description: This plugin helps to plot e.g. tables from chatGPT research on to your Figma or FigJam canvas to be able to overcome chat interface limitations and spatially distribute information quickly especially on lengthy brainstorms. The plugin uses the OpenAI API and requires your personal OpenAI API Key.
plugins.tagline: Plot chatGPT research on canvas

133314.name: GPT to Canvas
133314.description: This plugin helps to plot e.g. tables from chatGPT research on to your Figma or FigJam canvas to be able to overcome chat interface limitations and spatially distribute information quickly especially on lengthy brainstorms. The plugin uses the OpenAI API and requires your personal OpenAI API Key.

plugins.name: BorderBuddy
plugins.description:
Quickly inspect and update border radius values across selected frames in Figma.

BorderBuddy helps you speed up your workflow by displaying the current border radius of elements inside a selected frame, allowing you to adjust all values at once with a single click. Perfect for cleaning up inconsistent UI or testing design variations.
plugins.tagline: Quickly view and update the border radius of all elements within a selected frame in Figma.

133137.name: BorderBuddy
133137.description:
Quickly inspect and update border radius values across selected frames in Figma.

BorderBuddy helps you speed up your workflow by displaying the current border radius of elements inside a selected frame, allowing you to adjust all values at once with a single click. Perfect for cleaning up inconsistent UI or testing design variations.
133137.tagline: Quickly view and update the border radius of all elements within a selected frame in Figma.

plugins.name: Motionmill
plugins.description:
Prepare Your Figma File for Development with This Plugin


This Figma plugin helps you set up a well-organized and developer-friendly design file from the start. It allows you to quickly define and document your color palette and typography styles—both as Figma styles and directly within the design file.


By standardizing colors and text styles early in the process, you create a solid foundation for a consistent visual identity and a smoother handoff to development. Developers can easily reference the documented styles and convert them into design tokens or variables in code (e.g., CSS variables or a design system setup). This includes font families, sizes, line heights, and color codes—all clearly named and structured.


This plugin is perfect for teams looking to streamline collaboration between design and development. It saves time, reduces confusion, and ensures consistency throughout the project.
plugins.tagline: Colors and Typography for Motionmill

132803.name: Motionmill
132803.description:
Prepare Your Figma File for Development with This Plugin


This Figma plugin helps you set up a well-organized and developer-friendly design file from the start. It allows you to quickly define and document your color palette and typography styles—both as Figma styles and directly within the design file.


By standardizing colors and text styles early in the process, you create a solid foundation for a consistent visual identity and a smoother handoff to development. Developers can easily reference the documented styles and convert them into design tokens or variables in code (e.g., CSS variables or a design system setup). This includes font families, sizes, line heights, and color codes—all clearly named and structured.


This plugin is perfect for teams looking to streamline collaboration between design and development. It saves time, reduces confusion, and ensures consistency throughout the project.

plugins.name: Variant Randomizer
plugins.description:
Tired of manually clicking through component variants one by one just to create visual variety in your mockups? Variant Randomizer is here to help! This simple yet powerful Figma plugin lets you instantly randomize the variants applied to multiple selected components or instances that have more than one variant option.


How it Works:

Select multiple elements (components/instances) on your canvas.

Run the [Plugin Name] plugin.

Done! The plugin automatically assigns a random variant to each selected element that has multiple variants available. Elements with only one variant or no variants will be ignored.


Why use Variant Randomizer?

Save Valuable Time: Stop the tedious process of manually changing variants across many elements.

Create Realistic Mockups: Quickly add natural variation to lists, grids, user avatars, button states, icons, and more.

Boost Productivity: Perfect for working with design systems and large sets of components.

Simple & Fast: One-click operation after selection.

Works on Selection: Target only the elements you need to change.



You can help me mantain this plugin by Buying me a coffee!
plugins.tagline: nstantly randomize component variants across your selection.

plugins.name: Blueprint
plugins.description:
Blueprint is a UX documentation tool that helps create UX flows & development instructions lightning fast. Just import your Figma designs to Blueprint and create UX flows on its grid-based canvas.

Visit blueprintapp.design to learn more about Blueprint!


Key features:

  1. Import Figma design: Import selected frames or the entire page.
  2. Grid canvas: Arrange and organize Figma frames super fast.
  3. UX flowchart: Draw UX flows with arrows and diagrams using Figma designs, making it easier to communicate with your teammates.
  4. Add annotations: Write down instructions or detailed guidance about a selected scene for clearer communications.


To get started:

  1. Install the Plugin from the Figma Community
  2. Enter your Figma File URL
  3. Choose specific Frames or import all Frames to Blueprint
  4. Click the "Open on Blueprint" button to begin designing your UX flows
plugins.tagline: High-fidelity UX Flows Made Effortless

plugins.name: Galactic Name Generator
plugins.description:
⚙ Ce plugin est actuellement en version beta


⭐️ Différents types de noms

Réels : Générez des noms inspirés des véritables personnages de l'univers.

Jeux de mots : Des variations créatives des noms emblématiques.


📐 Personnalisation

Genre : Choisissez parmi "Tous", "Homme" ou "Femme" pour des résultats adaptés.

Ordre : Affichez les noms dans l'ordre "Prénom Nom" ou "Nom Prénom" selon vos besoins.


🪄 Génération Rapide

Sélectionnez vos préférences et laissez le plugin faire le reste.


------


Beta : 2025 05 02
plugins.tagline: Générez des noms de personnages d'une galaxie lointaine, très lointaine, à la vitesse de la lumière

131073.name: Galactic Name Generator

⭐️ Différents types de noms

🪄 Génération Rapide

Sélectionnez vos préférences et laissez le plugin faire le reste.

plugins.name: Section Logger
plugins.description: ¡No pierdas ni un cambio! Con Section Logger, cada modificación en tus secciones de Figma queda registrada automáticamente. Visualiza los cambios en tiempo real, guarda un historial detallado de tus ediciones y personaliza el diseño con colores que se ajustan a tu estilo. Ideal para equipos que buscan organización, colaboración y eficiencia. ¡Mejora tu flujo de trabajo ahora!
plugins.tagline: Transforma tu flujo de trabajo: registra, organiza y visualiza cambios de diseño veloz.

129666.name: Section Logger
129666.description: ¡No pierdas ni un cambio! Con Section Logger, cada modificación en tus secciones de Figma queda registrada automáticamente. Visualiza los cambios en tiempo real, guarda un historial detallado de tus ediciones y personaliza el diseño con colores que se ajustan a tu estilo. Ideal para equipos que buscan organización, colaboración y eficiencia. ¡Mejora tu flujo de trabajo ahora!
129666.release_notes:
Release Note: Versión 1.1

Nuevas funcionalidades:
1.Soporte de idioma (Español/Inglés):
•Se ha implementado un selector de idioma en la UI del plugin, que permite cambiar entre español e inglés con un switch/slider intuitivo.
•El idioma de la interfaz (títulos, botones y textos) cambia dinámicamente según la selección del usuario.
•El texto de los logs registrados también cambia de idioma, mostrando la información correctamente tanto en español como en inglés, dependiendo del idioma seleccionado.
2.Actualización de sticker:
•Mejora de la gestión de stickers: Ahora, si un sticker ya existe, se actualiza con los nuevos logs en lugar de crear uno nuevo cada vez que se registra una edición.
•Si el sticker ya está presente, su contenido se limpia y se reemplaza con los nuevos logs, garantizando que no haya stickers duplicados.

Mejoras adicionales:
•Se mejoró el posicionamiento dinámico del sticker, asegurando que se mantenga correctamente ubicado en la esquina superior izquierda de la sección.
•Se optimizó el código para hacer el plugin más eficiente y evitar la creación de stickers innecesarios.

Fixes:
•Se solucionó un problema en el que un nuevo sticker se creaba cada vez que se registraba un log, incluso si ya existía uno previamente.
129666.tagline: Transforma tu flujo de trabajo: registra, organiza y visualiza cambios de diseño veloz.

plugins.name: ColourSwatch
plugins.description:
Enhance your Figma workflow with the ColourSwatch plugin


Streamline the creation, management, and updating of colour swatches using local or published Figma colour variables. This plugin provides a clear visual overview of all the colours in your project, ensuring consistency and efficiency.


With this plugin, you can easily create a ColourSwatch component. For each colour variable —whether from a local collection or a linked, published Figma library — you can generate a component instance. Use the plugin to effortlessly update values such as hex codes, alpha values, and colour variable names — one by one or as a batch for all colour swatches on the same page.
plugins.tagline: Create maintain and update colour swatches based on your Figma colour variables.

plugins.name: Quanta Symphony Design Review
plugins.description:
The Automated Design Review Checklist ensures that UI/UX designs maintain high standards of organization, accessibility, layout, and content quality. It systematically evaluates design files to identify potential issues and improve usability.


In terms of Layer Organization, it checks for clear and descriptive layer names, flagging defaults like “Rectangle 1,” “Text 1,” “Frame,” or “Group.” It also detects hidden layers, ensures layers used as masks are correctly applied, and verifies the presence of effects to maintain design consistency.


For Accessibility, the checklist validates text contrast ratios against WCAG 2.1 standards to ensure readability:

•Regular text (< 18px) must have a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1.

•Large text (≥ 18px or ≥ 14px bold) should meet a minimum contrast ratio of 3:1.

It also warns if text size is below 14px, flags elements smaller than 24x24px (as they might be too small for touch targets), and checks for opacity settings that could impact visibility.


The Layout Review identifies problematic scale constraints that could cause resizing issues and evaluates layer dimensions to ensure usability across different screen sizes.


In terms of Content, the system detects empty text layers that may indicate missing information and checks text properties to maintain proper styling, readability, and hierarchy.


By automating these design checks, this system helps designers streamline their workflow, ensuring consistency, accessibility, and overall design quality before final delivery.
plugins.tagline: Automate. Validate. Elevate.

127028.name: Quanta Symphony Design Review
127028.description:
The Automated Design Review Checklist ensures that UI/UX designs maintain high standards of organization, accessibility, layout, and content quality. It systematically evaluates design files to identify potential issues and improve usability.


In terms of Layer Organization, it checks for clear and descriptive layer names, flagging defaults like “Rectangle 1,” “Text 1,” “Frame,” or “Group.” It also detects hidden layers, ensures layers used as masks are correctly applied, and verifies the presence of effects to maintain design consistency.


For Accessibility, the checklist validates text contrast ratios against WCAG 2.1 standards to ensure readability:

•Regular text (< 18px) must have a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1.

•Large text (≥ 18px or ≥ 14px bold) should meet a minimum contrast ratio of 3:1.

It also warns if text size is below 14px, flags elements smaller than 24x24px (as they might be too small for touch targets), and checks for opacity settings that could impact visibility.


The Layout Review identifies problematic scale constraints that could cause resizing issues and evaluates layer dimensions to ensure usability across different screen sizes.


In terms of Content, the system detects empty text layers that may indicate missing information and checks text properties to maintain proper styling, readability, and hierarchy.


By automating these design checks, this system helps designers streamline their workflow, ensuring consistency, accessibility, and overall design quality before final delivery.

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin needs to access external resources for WCAG contrast checking and design pattern validation.

plugins.name: Interflow Connect
plugins.description:
Transform your design-to-management workflow with Interflow Connect, the Figma plugin that brings your UI flows directly into the Interflow. Designed for product teams and designers who demand efficiency, Interflow Connect eliminates the tedious process of manual uploads, allowing you to focus on what truly matters—creating exceptional user interfaces.


Streamlined Workflow, Unmatched Efficiency


With Interflow Connect, transferring your designs from Figma to Interflow is as simple as a few clicks. Select your desired frames within Figma, assign or create the appropriate flow and section names, and upload your screens directly to the Interflow without ever leaving your design environment. This seamless integration ensures your UI flows are always up-to-date and easily accessible for audits and reviews, making collaboration across teams more efficient than ever.


Secure, Direct Integration


Security and simplicity are at the heart of Interflow Connect. By inputting and authenticating your personal API key—generated from your Interflow settings—the plugin securely identifies your account, organization, and product. This robust authentication process guarantees that your design data is transmitted safely and accurately, offering a streamlined connection between your creative process in Figma and your product management workflow in Interflow.


Empower Your Product Design and Management


Interflow Connect is more than just a plugin—it’s the bridge between your design interface and your management platform. Whether you’re refining your product’s UI, conducting detailed audits, or ensuring that every screen aligns with your design strategy, this plugin is engineered to supercharge your workflow. Enjoy a smoother onboarding process, reduce manual errors, and keep your design projects perfectly synchronized with your product roadmap.


Experience a new level of productivity and collaboration by integrating your design and management tools. With Interflow Connect, you’re not just uploading screens—you’re empowering your team to build better products, faster.
plugins.tagline: The bridge between your interfaces in figma and your interflow.

plugins.name: K Translation
plugins.description:
K Translation is a localization tool designed to simplify the process of translating your Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files.


After installing the plugin, the user uploads an XLIFF file containing translations. The plugin analyzes the file, determines the source language, and lists available target languages.


The user then selects which languages to translate the frame into. To begin the translation, simply select a frame in Figma that contains text elements.


Once the "Create copy" button is pressed, the plugin automatically scans all the text within the frame and creates copies of the frame for each selected target language, effectively localizing your design with just a few click.
plugins.tagline: K Translation: localize Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files in just a few clicks.

103740.name: K Translation
103740.description:
K Translation is a localization tool designed to simplify the process of translating your Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files.


After installing the plugin, the user uploads an XLIFF file containing translations. The plugin analyzes the file, determines the source language, and lists available target languages.


The user then selects which languages to translate the frame into. To begin the translation, simply select a frame in Figma that contains text elements.


Once the "Create copy" button is pressed, the plugin automatically scans all the text within the frame and creates copies of the frame for each selected target language, effectively localizing your design with just a few click.
103740.release_notes: Added the ability to download a file containing texts that were not translated.
103740.tagline: K Translation: localize Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files in just a few clicks.

plugins.name: Update Genres Usage
plugins.description:
The page must have at least one of the following section hierarchies with the following names and elements within them:


- info (section)
    - genre (section)
        - genre name (shape with text)   <----|
    - game (section)                      (connection)
        - game name (shape with text)    <----|



Genre name must be connected to shapes containing game names and only to them.




For example we have such structure:




"info" section _______________________________________
|
| "genre" section _________________________
| |                                       |
| |  "genre name 1"        "genre name 2" |
| |_________|_____________________|________
|           |-------------------> |
| "game" s._|____       "game" s._|_____
| |         v   |       |         v    |
| | "game name1"|       | "game name2" |
| |______________       |_______________
|
|_______________________________________________




After the update, it will look like this


"info" section _______________________________________
|
| "genre" section _________________________
| |                                       |
| |  "genre name 1"        "genre name 2" |
| |     (2/2)                   (1/2)     |
| |_________|_____________________|________
|           |-------------------> |
| "game" s._|____       "game" s._|_____
| |         v   |       |         v    |
| | "game name1"|       | "game name2" |
| |______________       |_______________
|
|_______________________________________________
plugins.tagline: Update Genres Usage

plugins.name: TypeGrid
plugins.description:
TypeGrid allows you to:

  1. Generate a typescale: Choose your base font size, ratio, and number of steps, and the plugin instantly creates a preview of your typescale.
  2. Apply a baseline grid: Set your baseline unit and rounding mode, and the plugin ensures your text layers align perfectly to the grid.
  3. Create text layers: With a single click, generate text layers for each step in your typescale, automatically named and styled.
  4. Create text styles: Generate Figma text styles for each step in your typescale, making it easy to apply consistent typography throughout your design.
  5. Preview with custom fonts: See how your typescale looks with any font installed on your system, including different weights.
  6. Fine-tune your settings: Adjust your typescale and baseline grid settings in real-time to get the perfect look for your design.
  7. Save time and ensure consistency: Automate the tedious process of creating and managing typescales and baseline grids, saving you time and ensuring consistency across your designs.
plugins.tagline: Streamline typography with typescale previews, text styles, and a consistent baseline grid.

135876.name: TypeGrid
135876.description:

  2. Apply a baseline grid: Set your baseline unit and rounding mode, and the plugin ensures your text layers align perfectly to the grid.
  3. Create text layers: With a single click, generate text layers for each step in your typescale, automatically named and styled.
  4. Create text styles: Generate Figma text styles for each step in your typescale, making it easy to apply consistent typography throughout your design.
  5. Preview with custom fonts: See how your typescale looks with any font installed on your system, including different weights.
  6. Fine-tune your settings: Adjust your typescale and baseline grid settings in real-time to get the perfect look for your design.
  7. Save time and ensure consistency: Automate the tedious process of creating and managing typescales and baseline grids, saving you time and ensuring consistency across your designs.
135876.tagline: Streamline typography with typescale previews, text styles, and a consistent baseline grid.

plugins.name: Slide Auto-Numbering by Works.
plugins.description:
Slide Auto-Numbering


This plugin automatically numbers your Figma Slides. Wherever a TEXT layer named “page number” exists, it will be overwritten with the correct slide index (1, 2, 3, …).


How to use:

• Ensure each slide has a TEXT layer named “page number.”

• Run the plugin (Plugins → Development → Slide Auto-Numbering → Run).

• The plugin will number the slides linearly in the order provided by Figma Slides.
plugins.tagline: Auto-number your slides ;)

135716.name: Slide Auto-Numbering by Works.
135716.description:
Slide Auto-Numbering


This plugin automatically numbers your Figma Slides. Wherever a TEXT layer named “page number” exists, it will be overwritten with the correct slide index (1, 2, 3, …).


How to use:

• Ensure each slide has a TEXT layer named “page number.”

• Run the plugin (Plugins → Development → Slide Auto-Numbering → Run).

• The plugin will number the slides linearly in the order provided by Figma Slides.
135716.release_notes: This plugin is for only for Figma Slides, the Figma Design option is removed to avoid confusion.

plugins.name: Tailwind Text Styles Generator
plugins.description:
Tailwind Text Style Generator is a Figma plugin that helps you automatically generate text styles from Google Fonts, based on Tailwind typography scale.


Tired of manually creating text styles and organizing layers one by one? This plugin does it all for you:


🎨 Choose from 1,800+ Google Fonts

📏 Auto-generate Text Styles using Tailwind-friendly sizing (sm, base, lg, xl, etc.)

⚡ Perfect for dev-design alignment especially for teams using Tailwind CSS

📁 Organized neatly: styles are grouped and named by scale

🔁 Try different fonts freely great for experimenting and iterating

💾 Instantly saved into your current design system


Whether you're building a design system or just want to speed up your workflow, this plugin makes it seamless, scalable, and developer-friendly.
plugins.tagline: 1.800 Fonts. 1 Click. Done.

134942.name: Tailwind Text Styles Generator
134942.description:
Tailwind Text Style Generator is a Figma plugin that helps you automatically generate text styles from Google Fonts, based on Tailwind typography scale.


Tired of manually creating text styles and organizing layers one by one? This plugin does it all for you:


🎨 Choose from 1,800+ Google Fonts

📏 Auto-generate Text Styles using Tailwind-friendly sizing (sm, base, lg, xl, etc.)

⚡ Perfect for dev-design alignment especially for teams using Tailwind CSS

📁 Organized neatly: styles are grouped and named by scale

🔁 Try different fonts freely great for experimenting and iterating

💾 Instantly saved into your current design system


Whether you're building a design system or just want to speed up your workflow, this plugin makes it seamless, scalable, and developer-friendly.

manifest.name: Tailwind Text Styles Generator by HamdanDev

134942.release_notes: Added a daily limit of 2 generations per user, persistent error notifications, and support for a default Google Fonts API key.

plugins.name: QR Generator
plugins.description:
Generate crisp, scannable QR codes directly in Figma—for free. Whether you’re linking to a website, product, or prototype, it’s never been easier to add functional codes to your designs.


Need more than just the basics? Unlock the ability to fully customize your QR codes:

– Adjust colors to match your brand

– Tweak corner and eye styles

– Control padding, sizing, and error correction

– Apply your own design language


Perfect for teams and designers who want their work to look as good as it works.

Use it for client presentations, posters, packaging, or anything else where detail matters.


Free to generate. Paid to make it yours.


You can contact us at support@easestud.io

visit easestud.io
plugins.tagline: Simple QR codes, beautifully yours.

plugins.description: This app allows you to create detailed store maps and integrate them with the Vusion application to geolocate articles within your store.

plugins.name: Section Auto-Resize with 200px Margin
plugins.description:
This plugin automatically resizes Figma Sections to fit their content and adds a 200px margin around the content area. It's designed to help teams maintain consistent spacing and layout rules without manually adjusting section boundaries.


Perfect for teams working with grid systems, spacing standards, or design system alignment workflows.
plugins.tagline: Auto-resize sections and apply consistent 200px margin padding.

133400.name: Section Auto-Resize with 200px Margin
133400.description:
This plugin automatically resizes Figma Sections to fit their content and adds a 200px margin around the content area. It's designed to help teams maintain consistent spacing and layout rules without manually adjusting section boundaries.


Perfect for teams working with grid systems, spacing standards, or design system alignment workflows.
133400.tagline: Auto-resize sections and apply consistent 200px margin padding.

plugins.name: Reverse Variable Order
plugins.description:
Easily reverse the order of your variable values with


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables
  4. Reverse


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive.
  2. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate.


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Flip the order of values in your variable groups

132291.tagline: Flip the order of values in your variable groups

plugins.name: Figma 2 FRIDA
plugins.description: Users can select Figma frames to automatically generate clean, functional code for Flutter, React, Kotlin and Angular, with the code adapting to the specific data within the frames. This includes not only the UI components but also layout structures and other relevant data. Additionally, the tool provides the ability to generate automated test cases based on the generated code, helping ensure quality and functionality. For app deployment, users can generate the necessary icon files tailored for various platforms, simplifying the process for app deployment across different app stores and environments.
plugins.tagline: Generate code for both mobile and web based on Figma UI designs.

plugins.name: Fig-Refactor
plugins.description:
Call for Sponsorship: Support the Development


Fig-Refactor – Replace Spacing with Figma Variables in One Click


Fig-Refactor is a Figma plugin designed to bring structure and scalability to your design files by replacing hardcoded gaps and paddings with Figma variables — in bulk.


Fig-Refactor intelligently scans your selection or entire file, matches raw spacing values to the closest variable from your local or team library, and replaces them with a single click. It even skips values already using variables, keeping your workflow non-destructive and efficient.


✨ Features:

  1. 🔍 Smart matching – Suggests the closest variable for each spacing value
  2. 🧠 Supports team libraries – Load and use variables from shared libraries
  3. 📁 Flexible scanning – Target specific selections or scan the entire file
  4. 🚫 Non-destructive – Ignores values already assigned to a variable


Currently in active development, Fig-Refactor is already making design systems cleaner and easier to manage — and with your support, it can go even further. Your sponsorship helps fund ongoing development, bug fixes, and new features like auto-thresholds, preview modes, and batch review.


📹 DEMO

❤️ Support this project


Your support helps keep this plugin alive and evolving.

Thank you for making design better for everyone!
plugins.tagline: Refactor Your  Figma Spacing  in Seconds

plugins.name: View Jumper
plugins.description: View Jumper helps designers quickly navigate large Figma files by creating visual bookmarks. Users set two key locations (View A and View B) that they need to reference frequently, then instantly teleport between them with preserved zoom levels and page context. Whether using the UI buttons, menu commands, or keyboard shortcuts, this plugin eliminates the frustration of constantly scrolling and searching through complex designs, making workflow significantly more efficient when comparing or referencing different areas.

accepted.name: Christopher
accepted.description:
Product Design @ heyo.is
Brand Design @ MARKoftheBRAND.com

plugins.tagline: Set viewpoints A & B. Teleport between design locations with a click.
